1.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

2.text: Should a wise man make answer with vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

3.text: Should he reason with unprofitable talk, or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

4.text: Yea, thou doest away with fear, and restrainest devotion before God.

5.text: For thine iniquity teacheth thy mouth, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

6.text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I; yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

7.text: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou brought forth before the hills?

8.text: Hast thou heard the secret counsel of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

9.text: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?

10.text: With us are both the grayheaded and the very aged men, much elder than thy father.

11.text: Are the consolations of God too small for thee, and the word that dealeth gently with thee?

12.text: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and why do thine eyes wink?

13.text: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth.

14.text: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

15.text: Behold, he putteth no trust in his holy ones; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

16.text: How much less one that is abominable and corrupt, a man that drinketh iniquity like water!

17.text: I will shew thee, hear thou me; and that which I have seen I will declare:

18.text: (Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it;

19.text: Unto whom alone the land was given, and no stranger passed among them:)

20.text: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, even the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor.

21.text: A sound of terrors is in his ears; in prosperity the spoiler shall come upon him:

22.text: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword:

23.text: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand:

24.text: Distress and anguish make him afraid; they prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle:

25.text: Because he hath stretched out his hand against God, and behaveth himself proudly against the Almighty;

26.text: He runneth upon him with a stiff neck, with the thick bosses of his bucklers:

27.text: Because he hath covered his face with his fatness, and made collops of fat on his flanks;

28.text: And he hath dwelt in desolate cities, in houses which no man inhabited, which were ready to become heaps.

29.text: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall their produce bend to the earth.

30.text: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

31.text: Let him not trust in vanity, deceiving himself: for vanity shall be his recompence.

32.text: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

33.text: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

34.text: For the company of the godless shall be barren, and fire shall consume the tents of bribery.

35.text: They conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
